channel.title: Homes on Chao Zhang
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Chao Zhang

item.description: I am an assistant professor at School of Computational Science and Engineering, Georgia Tech. I obtained my Ph.D. in Computer Science from UIUC under the advisement of Prof. Jiawei Han. My research area is data mining and machine learning. I am particularly interested in developing label-efficient and robust learning techniques, with applications in text mining and spatiotemporal data mining. I am actively looking for talented and motivated students to work with me.

News [2018.11]: The code for our CIKM paper on weakly-supervised text classification is released. If you want to use deep neural nets to do text classification but don’t have much labeled data, try it out! [2018.11]: Our paper on weakly-supervised hierarchical text classification is accepted by AAAI’19. [2018.10]: Our paper on linear-time trajectory similarity computation is accepted by ICDE’19. It’s up to 100x faster than state-of-the-art trajectory similarity computation techniques and supports all major measures!
